metadata.title: CVE-2023-1981 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the avahi library. This flaw allows anunprivileged user to make a dbus call, causing the avahi daemon to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
avahi-daemon - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
avahi-discover - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
avahi-ui-utils - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
avahi-utils - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-client3 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-common-data - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-common3 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-core7 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-glib1 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
python-avahi - 0.7-4ubuntu7.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: avahi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7-4ubuntu7.2').
